description.narrative:
Stakeholders impact: The project will provide an additional US$400 million of direct on-lending to SMEs in LIS of India, a segment that is currently under-served in India. It would also support formal job creation by contributing to improvement in economic activity.
Market Impact: The project is a part of a series of counter-cyclical interventions IFC is undertaking in the NBFC sector in India with leading institutions to support the market by increasing funding to select NBFCs to strengthen their balance sheets so that they can provide finance access to underserved borrowers. The proposed investment will focus on CV financing in the LIS and thereby, support inclusive growth.

The proposed investment comprises a (up to 5-year) senior, secured funding of up to US$100 million to Tata Motors Finance Limited (TMFL or the Company). IFCs investment will be used to support purchase of Commercial Vehicles (CVs) by Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Low Income States (LIS) of India. The Company will match IFCs investment of US$100 million with US$300 million from its other sources of funding to create a US$400 million pool for financing CV purchases by SMEs in LIS. TMFL is engaged in the business of financing entire range of Tata Motors manufactured commercial vehicles, and passenger cars. TMFL has a presence over 270 branches spread across India to cater the needs of its customers. TMFL is the largest financier of Tata Motors vehicles and also offers customized product offerings to Tata Motors end customers.
